sections.description: How to cook a honey Mustard Glazed Ham
sections.title: Honey Mustard Glazed Ham

text_grid.title: Step 2
text_grid.description: Add the chopped onion, garlic cloves, apple cider vinegar, mustard, orange juice, and cloves to a large roasting pan, stirring to combine.

text_grid.title: Step 3
text_grid.description: Place the ham on the roasting rack over the liquid.

text_grid.title: Step 4
text_grid.description: Trim off tough outer skin, then score the remaining fat in a crosshatch pattern. Cover the entire roasting rack with aluminum foil and bake for 1 hour.

text_grid.title: Step 5
text_grid.description: Remove the ham from the oven, and remove the foil. Baste the ham with the liquid, then remove the rack from the roasting pan and set aside.

text_grid.title: Step 6
text_grid.description: Remove all the whole cloves from the remaining liquid in the pan. Pour the remaining liquid into a pot, along with the honey, Dijon mustard, Worcestershire sauce, and brown sugar. Whisk to combine.

text_grid.title: Step 7
text_grid.description: Bring the mixture to a boil over medium high heat, then simmer until thick and reduced, about 10 minutes.

text_grid.title: Step 8
text_grid.description: Brush the glaze on to the ham then transfer back to the roasting rack.

text_grid.title: Step 9
text_grid.description: Bake the ham for 30-45 minutes, or until the glaze is caramelized and the ham reaches 145째F (65째C). Slice the ham, and serve. Enjoy!
